body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09615-6 The most recent common ancestor of the stony coral Scleractinia dates to about 460 million years ago and was probably a solitary, heterotrophic and free-living organism.

title: Mapping Plasmodium transitions and interactions in the Anopheles female
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09653-0

Single-cell transcriptomic analyses of Plasmodium falciparum and Anopheles gambiae reveal key developmental stages, processes and factors in parasite–mosq…
body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09653-0 Single-cell transcriptomic analyses of Plasmodium falciparum and Anopheles gambiae reveal key developmental stages, processes and factors in parasite–mosquito interactions and identify potential targets for blocking malaria transmission.

title: Cryogenic X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy for battery interfaces
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09618-3

Cryogenic X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, combined with immediate plunge freezing, can be used to probe the pristine solid electrolyte interphase in lit…
body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09618-3 Cryogenic X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, combined with immediate plunge freezing, can be used to probe the pristine solid electrolyte interphase in lithium metal batteries.

title: Bottom-up design of Ca<sup>2+</sup> channels from defined selectivity filter geometry
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09646-z

De novo design of Ca2+ channels with ion selectivity that can assemble appropriately and mediate Ca2+ conductance when expressed in cells is described.
body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09646-z De novo design of Ca2+ channels with ion selectivity that can assemble appropriately and mediate Ca2+ conductance when expressed in cells is described.

title: Non-van der Waals superlattices of carbides and carbonitrides

A method to make a big family of non-van der Waals superlattices of carbides and carbonitrides based on the delamination and rolling-up of multilayer MXen…
body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09649-w A method to make a big family of non-van der Waals superlattices of carbides and carbonitrides based on the delamination and rolling-up of multilayer MXenes is presented.

title: Integration of hunger and hormonal state gates infant-directed aggression
summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09651-2 Combined behavioural, circuit-level and cellular approaches are used to demonstrate how hypothalamic neurons integrate hunger and oestrous state to drive a switch in how female mice interact with pups.

body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09670-z The peptide hormone Capa is responsible for regulating extracellular fluid Ca2+ levels in the fruit fly Drosophila melanogaster.

title: Pancreatic cancer relies on opposing signalling pathways to drive its cellular diversity
summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 22 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03133-1 Communication between epithelial and mesenchymal cells in pancreatic cancer leads to a poor prognosis. The molecular basis for this signalling has now been revealed.

title: People with some cancers live longer after a COVID vaccine
